text: Daniel Joseph "Rusty" Staub (April 1, 1944 - March 29, 2018) was an American Major League Baseball right fielder, designated hitter, and first baseman and philanthropist. He has a 23-year baseball career with 5 different teams. He was an original member of the Montreal Expos. Staub also played for the Houston Colt .45s, the New York Mets, the Detroit Tigers and the New York Yankees. On April 4, 1986, Staub established the Rusty Staub Foundation to provide educational scholarships for youth and fight hunger."The Rusty Staub Foundation". Guidestar. Retrieved March 29, 2018. In 1986, Staub founded the New York Police and Fire Widows' and Children's Benefit Fund, which supports the families of New York City police officers, firefighters, Port Authority police, and emergency medical personnel who were killed in the line of duty."NY Police and Fire Widows & Children's Benefit Fund, Inc." Guidestar. Retrieved March 29, 2018. In July 2006, Staub teamed with Mascot Books to publish his first children's book, Hello, Mr. Met. Staub died on March 29, 2018 of multiple organ failure complicated by respiratory tract infection- related pneumonia in West Palm Beach, Florida at the age of 73. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Deaths from respiratory tract infection Category:Disease-related deaths in Florida Category:Philanthropists from Louisiana Category:Houston Astros players Category:Montreal Expos players Category:New York Mets players Category:Detroit Tigers players Category:Texas Rangers players Category:Sportspeople from New Orleans
title: Rusty Staub
